name: Rooks Hill Guest House

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Big thanks to Lin for our lovely realxed stay in our mini suite.. Fantastic B&B within walking distance of two lovely pubs and loads of walks.. Cracking breakfast! Perfect few days away
reviews.title: Lovely realxed break

reviews.text: Rooks Hill B and B justifiably rates highly in TA reviews.
reviews.title: A superb stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room (Lavant) was very spacious and comfortable, well furnished with an added sitting area.
reviews.title: Terrific B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bed (king) was comfortable with excellent pillows. Triple glazing meant any road noise was absolutely minimal.
reviews.title: Beautiful!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bathroom was well fitted with good over bath shower, and the shower itself was really very good.
reviews.title: Worth the 5 stars

reviews.text: Hi there,
reviews.title: Letter from guest to the owners of Rooks Hill

reviews.text: Thank you very much for the lovely couple of nights I had at Rooks Hill. I have nothing but complementary things to say about your lovely B&B.
reviews.title: Amazing b&b!
Great stay!
reviews.text: When I made my reservation over the telephone, Ron pointed out that eateries book up really quickly in Chichester on Saturday evenings. I thought this was really thoughtful of him to mention this as I think I would have ended up being very hungry. I ensured I had supper before I travelled.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everything from the high standard of cleanliness, the delicious breakfast, the modern and sophisticated decor, to the lovely relaxed and welcoming atmosphere made my stay thoroughly enjoyable. For many reasons, I usually find it difficult to relax in hotels and B&B accommodation but I was blown away with Rooks Hill and I'd love to return.
reviews.title: Great!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'm going to recommend your accommodation to my friends and colleagues.
reviews.title: Clever Elsie

reviews.text: We were only booked for an 'overnight' en route home from Glyndebourne and visiting friends living nearby for dinner, but we were made to feel very welcome on arrival by Lin. We had opted for the 'suite' room Lavant, which is very spacious with a very comfortable super-king bed (other b&b owners with 'dodgy' beds please note!!!). The whole room was furnished to good 'hotel' standards. The bathroom is small but perfectly functional with plenty of fluffy towels and good toiletries.
reviews.title: A very 'up-market' b&b

reviews.text: Although the house is on a busy main road there was both secondary and tertiary glazing to our room which silenced the traffic noise almost totally and we had a very good night's sleep. A great idea for this lovely Grade II listed building.
reviews.title: Excellent service and friendly hosts

reviews.text: The following morning an excellent breakfast, cooked and served to us by Lin,saw us on our way. The delicious marmalades and jams deserve a special mention!
reviews.title: Great little weekend hideaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have no hesitation in recommending Rooks Hill. Not cheap, but we felt we had enjoyed real quality.
reviews.title: still as fantastic as ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were a party of five; two couples and one single, attending a wedding in the area. Rooks Hill Guest House was recommended by the wedding venue owners at Upwaltham Barns
reviews.title: First rate 3 Night stay at Rooks Hill

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All credit to Lin for making our stay at Rooks Hill such a pleasure. Lin was welcoming, happy and helpful in equal measure.
reviews.title: The Best!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A beautiful house, immaculately maintained and everything was perfect for our 4 day break in the 'Slindon' room, including the bonus of a superb view towards the Goodwood Estate in the distance. Extremely comfortable surroundings with a full choice of breakfast goodies which all tasted delicious and were beautifully presented.
reviews.title: Absolutely brilliant!

reviews.text: So many 'best bits' but my personal favourite was the lovely dressing table and large mirror that could accommodate all the must haves!!
reviews.title: Recommendation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very many thanks Lin, do hope we get to make a return visit.
reviews.title: Lovely, Lovely, Lovely!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What can I say that hasn't already been said - this B&B is fantastic! After being let down by another B&B near Chichester with only a week and a half to go until our stay, I was so pleased to find Rooks Hill on Tripadvisor. Lin was so friendly and helpful from the moment I first contacted her - she even booked us a table for dinner at the lovely pub (The Earl of March) which is directly opposite.
reviews.title: Russell & Jan

description: Rooks Hill is a beautiful grade II listed country house with three individually designed en-suite bedrooms and two luxury self catering apartments,combining traditional character with contemporary luxury. Situated at the foot of the South Downs and only 2 miles from the historic city of Chichester and Glorious Goodwood. Awarded AA 5 yellow stars, highly commended. A very warm welcome awaits you.
